title: Authorizes establishment of school district and board of cooperative educational services reserve funds for contributions to the state teachers' retirement system
summary: Authorizes the establishment by school districts and boards of cooperative educational services of retirement contribution reserve funds for the purposes of making contributions to the New York state teachers' retirement system.

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-

    1    Section  1.  Paragraphs b and c of subdivision 1 of section 6-r of the
    2  general municipal law, as added by chapter 260 of the laws of 2004,  are
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    b.  "Participating  employer"  means:  (I) a participating employer as
    5  defined in subdivision twenty of  section  two  of  the  retirement  and
    6  social  security  law  or in subdivision twenty of section three hundred
    7  two of such law; OR (II) AN EMPLOYER AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION THREE  OF
    8  SECTION FIVE HUNDRED ONE OF THE EDUCATION LAW.
    9    c.  "Retirement  contribution"  shall  mean  all or any portion of the
   10  amount payable by a municipal corporation to: (I) either  the  New  York
   11  state  and  local employees' retirement system or the New York state and

   14  (II)  THE NEW YORK STATE TEACHERS' RETIREMENT SYSTEM PURSUANT TO SECTION
   15  FIVE HUNDRED TWENTY-ONE OF THE EDUCATION LAW.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1590

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the general municipal law, in relation to authorizing school
districts and boards of cooperative educational services to establish
retirement contribution reserve funds for the purposes of the New York
state teachers' retirement system

PURPOSE:
The purpose of this bill is to authorize the establishment of
school district and board of cooperative educational services reserve
funds for contributions to the State Teachers Retirement System.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section one amends paragraphs band c of subdivision 1 of section 6-1
of the general municipal law, as added by chapter 260 of the laws of
2004.

Section two provides an immediate effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
Chapter 260 of the Laws of 2004 allowed public employers to create
Retirement Contribution Reserve Funds, which basically are "rainy day
funds" to defray the costs of future contributions to the
Common Retirement Fund (CRF). This was a reform sought after by local
governments and their advocates, in order assist localities in
managing their finances. However, while the two retirements systems
that make up the CRF were included in these reforms, the New York
State Teachers Retirement System (NYSTRS) was not.

This bill seeks to remedy this situation, and allow public employers
to create such Reserve Funds for future NYSTRS contributions on the
same basis as they are currently allowed to do for their CRF
contributions, thus expanding the scope of the important and
necessary reforms enacted by the Legislature in 2004.

This legislative allows but does not require participant in NYSTRS to
establish such reserve funds, and thus does not represent a mandate
on local governments.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.4945/A.4177 of 2009-2010.
S.5501/A.9599 of 2008-2009.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the state.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act will take effect immediately.
